Description: Ukraine said Tuesday that its forces had repelled a Russian effort to cross the Oskil river, which has long been a de facto front line across the east of the war-scarred country. The post Kyiv Says Repels Russian Push Over East Ukraine River appeared first on The Defense Post.

Title: China Accuses Philippine Ships of ‘Illegally Gathering’ at Disputed Reef
Description: China on Monday said it had taken 'control measures' against Philippine ships it accused of 'illegally gathering' near a disputed reef in the South China Sea. The post China Accuses Philippine Ships of ‘Illegally Gathering' at Disputed Reef appeared first on The Defense Post.

Title: Poland Orders Over 200 Sidewinder Block II Air-to-Air Missiles
Description: The Polish government has signed an approximately $175-million contract for the purchase of over 232 AIM-9X Sidewinder Block II air-to-air missiles from the US. The post Poland Orders Over 200 Sidewinder Block II Air-to-Air Missiles appeared first on The Defense Post.

Title: Iraqi Armed Group Urges Government to Deploy Troops to Syria
Description: Iraq's powerful Iran-aligned Kataeb Hezbollah armed group has called on Baghdad to send troops to Syria to support the Damascus government against a rebel offensive. The post Iraqi Armed Group Urges Government to Deploy Troops to Syria appeared first on The Defense Post.

Title: KNDS Deutschland to Provide CV90 Simulators for Swedish Army
Description: The Swedish Procurement Agency has contracted KNDS Deutschland to provide three CV9040D infantry fighting vehicle training simulators. The post KNDS Deutschland to Provide CV90 Simulators for Swedish Army appeared first on The Defense Post.

Title: US Announces New $725M Package for Ukraine Including More Mines
Description: The US announced a new $725 million military aid package for Ukraine that features a second tranche of landmines as well as anti-air and anti-armor weapons. The post US Announces New $725M Package for Ukraine Including More Mines appeared first on The Defense Post.

Title: Turkey Claims to Have Killed Kurdish Commander in Syria
Description: The Turkish secret service has killed a leader of the banned Kurdistan Workers' Party in Syria, the state news agency said Monday. The post Turkey Claims to Have Killed Kurdish Commander in Syria appeared first on The Defense Post.
